TITLE: Implementing Starlette Admin with SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Example of setting up a Starlette Admin interface using SQLAlchemy ORM. It defines a Post model, creates an admin instance, and mounts it to a Starlette or FastAPI application. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from sqlalchemy import create_engine from sqlalchemy.ext.declarative import declarative_base from sqlalchemy.orm import Mapped, mapped_column from starlette.applications import Starlette from starlette_admin.contrib.sqla import Admin, ModelView Base = declarative_base() engine = create_engine("sqlite:///test.db", connect_args={"check_same_thread": False}) # Define your model class Post(Base): __tablename__ = "posts" id: Mapped[int] = mapped_column(primary_key=True) title: Mapped[str] Base.metadata.create_all(engine) app = Starlette() # FastAPI() # Create admin admin = Admin(engine, title="Example: SQLAlchemy") # Add view admin.add_view(ModelView(Post)) # Mount admin to your app admin.mount_to(app) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing Starlette Admin with Different Database Backends DESCRIPTION: Shows how to initialize the Starlette Admin interface with various database engines including SQLAlchemy, SQLModel, MongoEngine, and ODMantic. Each example demonstrates the basic setup required for the respective database backend. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/user-guide/getting-started/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from sqlalchemy import create_engine from starlette_admin.contrib.sqla import Admin engine = create_engine("sqlite:///test.db", connect_args={"check_same_thread": False}) admin = Admin(engine) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Custom Validation with SQLAlchemy ModelView DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to implement custom validation logic by extending the ModelView class and implementing a validate method that checks specific business rules. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/user-guide/validations/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from starlette_admin.contrib.sqla import ModelView from starlette_admin.exceptions import FormValidationError class PostView(ModelView): async def validate(self, request: Request, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> None: """Raise FormValidationError to display error in forms""" errors: Dict[str, str] = dict() _2day_from_today = date.today() + timedelta(days=2) if data["title"] is None or len(data["title"]) < 3: errors["title"] = "Ensure this value has at least 03 characters" if data["text"] is None or len(data["text"]) < 10: errors["text"] = "Ensure this value has at least 10 characters" if data["date"] is None or data["date"] < _2day_from_today: errors["date"] = "We need at least one day to verify your post" if data["publisher"] is None: errors["publisher"] = "Publisher is required" if data["tags"] is None or len(data["tags"]) < 1: errors["tags"] = "At least one tag is required" if len(errors) > 0: raise FormValidationError(errors) return await super().validate(request, data) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Batch Actions in Starlette-Admin Python DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to implement custom batch actions in a Starlette-Admin ModelView. It includes examples of a 'make_published' action with a custom form and a 'redirect' action with a custom response. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/user-guide/actions/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from typing import List, Any from starlette.datastructures import FormData from starlette.requests import Request from starlette.responses import RedirectResponse, Response from starlette_admin import action from starlette_admin.contrib.sqla import ModelView from starlette_admin.exceptions import ActionFailed class ArticleView(ModelView): actions = ["make_published", "redirect", "delete"] # `delete` function is added by default @action( name="make_published", text="Mark selected articles as published", confirmation="Are you sure you want to mark selected articles as published ?", submit_btn_text="Yes, proceed", submit_btn_class="btn-success", form="""
""", ) async def make_published_action(self, request: Request, pks: List[Any]) -> str: # Write your logic here data: FormData = await request.form() user_input = data.get("example-text-input") if ...: # Display meaningfully error raise ActionFailed("Sorry, We can't proceed this action now.") # Display successfully message return "{} articles were successfully marked as published".format(len(pks)) # For custom response @action( name="redirect", text="Redirect", custom_response=True, confirmation="Fill the form", form='''
''' ) async def redirect_action(self, request: Request, pks: List[Any]) -> Response: data = await request.form() return RedirectResponse(f"https://example.com/?value={data['value']}") ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing ModelView Hooks DESCRIPTION: Shows how to implement hooks for customizing CRUD operations in ModelView. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/user-guide/configurations/modelview/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` class OrderView(ModelView): async def after_create(self, request: Request, order: Order): analytics.track_order_created(order) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Starlette-Admin Setup with SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Example of setting up Starlette-Admin with SQLAlchemy ORM. It includes defining a model, creating the admin interface, and mounting it to a Starlette or FastAPI application. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from sqlalchemy import create_engine from sqlalchemy.ext.declarative import declarative_base from sqlalchemy.orm import Mapped, mapped_column from starlette.applications import Starlette from starlette_admin.contrib.sqla import Admin, ModelView Base = declarative_base() engine = create_engine("sqlite:///test.db", connect_args={"check_same_thread": False}) # Define your model class Post(Base): __tablename__ = "posts" id: Mapped[int] = mapped_column(primary_key=True) title: Mapped[str] Base.metadata.create_all(engine) app = Starlette() # FastAPI() # Create admin admin = Admin(engine, title="Example: SQLAlchemy") # Add view admin.add_view(ModelView(Post)) # Mount admin to your app admin.mount_to(app) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Pydantic Validation with SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use Pydantic for data validation with SQLAlchemy models by defining a Pydantic model and using the ModelView from starlette_admin.contrib.sqla.ext.pydantic. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/user-guide/validations/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from starlette_admin.contrib.sqla.ext.pydantic import ModelView class Post(Base): __tablename__ = "posts" id = Column(Integer, primary_key=True) title = Column(String) content = Column(Text) views = Column(Integer) class PostIn(BaseModel): id: Optional[int] = Field(primary_key=True) title: str = Field(min_length=3) content: str = Field(min_length=10) views: int = Field(multiple_of=4) @validator("title") def title_must_contain_space(cls, v): if " " not in v.strip(): raise ValueError("title must contain a space") return v.title() # Add view admin.add_view(ModelView(Post, pydantic_model=PostIn)) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining BaseAdmin Class for Starlette Admin in Python DESCRIPTION: This code snippet defines the BaseAdmin class, which is the foundation for admin models in Starlette Admin. It includes methods for managing fields, configuring the model, and handling various admin-related operations. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/api/base-admin/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Python CODE: ``` class BaseAdmin: """Base class for admin models.""" model: Optional[Type[Any]] = None icon: str = "fa-solid fa-table" name: Optional[str] = None label: Optional[str] = None title_field: Optional[str | Callable] = None ordering: Optional[Union[str, Sequence[str]]] = None identity: Optional[str | Sequence[str]] = None fields: Optional[Sequence[Union[str, Field]]] = None exclude: Optional[Sequence[str]] = None search_builder: bool = False search_builder_fields: Optional[Sequence[str]] = None collection_name: Optional[str] = None abstract = False validators: List[Type[FormValidator]] = [] custom_actions: List[BaseAction] = [] list_actions: Optional[List[BaseAction]] = None details_actions: Optional[List[BaseAction]] = None item_actions: Optional[List[BaseAction]] = None def __init_subclass__(cls, **kwargs: Any) -> None: super().__init_subclass__(**kwargs) if not cls.abstract: if cls.model is None: raise ValueError(f"model is required for {cls.__name__}") if cls.name is None: cls.name = cls.model.__name__.lower() if cls.label is None: cls.label = cls.model.__name__ if cls.collection_name is None: cls.collection_name = inflection.pluralize(cls.name) def __init__(self): self._fields = None self._identity = None self._title_field = None self._search_builder_fields = None self._list_actions = None self._details_actions = None self._item_actions = None def get_fields(self) -> List[Field]: """Get all fields for this model.""" if self._fields is None: self._fields = self._collect_fields() return self._fields def get_search_builder_fields(self) -> List[str]: """Get all fields for search builder.""" if self._search_builder_fields is None: self._search_builder_fields = ( self.search_builder_fields if self.search_builder_fields is not None else [f.name for f in self.get_fields() if f.searchable] ) return self._search_builder_fields def get_identity(self) -> Sequence[str]: """Get identity fields.""" if self._identity is None: self._identity = self._collect_identity() return self._identity def get_title_field(self) -> str: """Get title field.""" if self._title_field is None: self._title_field = self._collect_title_field() return self._title_field def get_list_actions(self) -> List[BaseAction]: """Get actions for list view.""" if self._list_actions is None: self._list_actions = ( self.list_actions if self.list_actions is not None else [DeleteAction()] ) return self._list_actions def get_details_actions(self) -> List[BaseAction]: """Get actions for details view.""" if self._details_actions is None: self._details_actions = ( self.details_actions if self.details_actions is not None else [DeleteAction()] ) return self._details_actions def get_item_actions(self) -> List[BaseAction]: """Get actions for individual items.""" if self._item_actions is None: self._item_actions = ( self.item_actions if self.item_actions is not None else [EditAction(), DeleteAction()] ) return self._item_actions def _collect_fields(self) -> List[Field]: """Collect fields for this model.""" raise NotImplementedError() def _collect_identity(self) -> Sequence[str]: """Collect identity fields.""" if self.identity: return self.identity if isinstance(self.identity, Sequence) else [self.identity] return [f.name for f in self.get_fields() if f.primary_key] def _collect_title_field(self) -> str: """Collect title field.""" if self.title_field: return self.title_field for field in self.get_fields(): if field.name in ["name", "title", "username", "email"]: return field.name return self.get_identity()[0] def list_query(self, request: Request) -> Any: """Query for retrieving all records.""" raise NotImplementedError() def get_list_field_value(self, request: Request, obj: Any, field: Field) -> Any: """Get value for a field in list view.""" raise NotImplementedError() def search_query(self, request: Request, term: str) -> Any: """Query for searching records.""" raise NotImplementedError() def get_count(self, request: Request, query: Any) -> int: """Get count of records.""" raise NotImplementedError() def get_list_result(self, request: Request, query: Any, offset: int, limit: int) -> List[Any]: """Get list of records.""" raise NotImplementedError() def get_object_for_details(self, request: Request, pk: Any) -> Any: """Get object for details view.""" raise NotImplementedError() def get_object_for_edit(self, request: Request, pk: Any) -> Any: """Get object for edit view.""" raise NotImplementedError() def get_form_data(self, request: Request, obj: Any) -> Dict[str, Any]: """Get form data for object.""" raise NotImplementedError() def before_create(self, request: Request, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]: """Hook before creating a new record.""" return data def create(self, request: Request, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Any: """Create a new record.""" raise NotImplementedError() def after_create(self, request: Request, obj: Any) -> None: """Hook after creating a new record.""" pass def before_update(self, request: Request, obj: Any, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]: """Hook before updating a record.""" return data def update(self, request: Request, obj: Any, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Any: """Update a record.""" raise NotImplementedError() def after_update(self, request: Request, obj: Any) -> None: """Hook after updating a record.""" pass def delete(self, request: Request, pks: List[Any]) -> Optional[List[Any]]: """Delete records.""" raise NotImplementedError() def get_detail_field_value(self, request: Request, obj: Any, field: Field) -> Any: """Get value for a field in detail view.""" raise NotImplementedError() def get_default_action(self) -> Optional[BaseAction]: """Get default action for this model.""" return None def has_add_permission(self, request: Request) -> bool: """Check if user has permission to add records.""" return True def has_edit_permission(self, request: Request) -> bool: """Check if user has permission to edit records.""" return True def has_delete_permission(self, request: Request) -> bool: """Check if user has permission to delete records.""" return True def has_detail_permission(self, request: Request) -> bool: """Check if user has permission to view details.""" return True def has_list_permission(self, request: Request) -> bool: """Check if user has permission to list records.""" return True ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Model Views to Starlette Admin DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to add model views for managing database models through the admin interface. Shows implementation for different ORMs with User and Post models. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/user-guide/getting-started/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from sqlalchemy import create_engine from starlette_admin.contrib.sqla import Admin, ModelView from .models import User, Post engine = create_engine("sqlite:///test.db", connect_args={"check_same_thread": False}) admin = Admin(engine) admin.add_view(ModelView(User)) admin.add_view(ModelView(Post)) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Field Exclusions in ModelView DESCRIPTION: Shows how to exclude specific fields from different views using the exclude_fields configuration options. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/user-guide/configurations/modelview/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` class PostView(ModelView): exclude_fields_from_list = [Post.content, Post.tags] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Custom Admin Views DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create custom admin views not tied to any model, including simple views with templates and views with custom render logic. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/user-guide/getting-started/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from starlette_admin import CustomView admin.add_view(CustomView(label="Home", icon="fa fa-home", path="/home", template_path="home.html")) ``` LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from starlette.requests import Request from starlette.responses import Response from starlette.templating import Jinja2Templates from starlette_admin import CustomView class HomeView(CustomView): async def render(self, request: Request, templates: Jinja2Templates) -> Response: return templates.TemplateResponse( request, name="home.html", context={"latest_posts": ..., "top_users": ...}, ) admin.add_view(HomeView(label="Home", icon="fa fa-home", path="/home")) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing Starlette Admin with Custom Configuration DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to initialize a Starlette Admin instance with various customization options including title, URLs, authentication, templates, and internationalization settings. The configuration demonstrates setting up custom views, authentication providers, and static resource locations. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/user-guide/configurations/admin/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` admin = Admin( title="SQLModel Admin", base_url="/admin", route_name="admin", statics_dir="statics/admin", templates_dir="templates/admin", logo_url="`https`://preview.tabler.io/static/logo-white.svg", login_logo_url="`https`://preview.tabler.io/static/logo.svg", index_view=CustomView(label="Home", icon="fa fa-home", path="/home", template_path="home.html"), auth_provider=MyAuthProvider(login_path="/sign-in", logout_path="/sign-out"), middlewares=[], debug=False, i18n_config = I18nConfig(default_locale="en") ) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Search and Sort Options in ModelView DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates configuration of searchable and sortable fields along with default sorting options in ModelView. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/user-guide/configurations/modelview/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` class PostView(ModelView): sortable_fields = [Post.id, "title"] searchable_fields = [Post.id, Post.title, "tags"] fields_default_sort = ["title", ("price", True)] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complete Custom Field Implementation DESCRIPTION: Full implementation of CustomField with data processing methods and value serialization. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/advanced/custom-field/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from dataclasses import dataclass from typing import Any, Dict from requests import Request from starlette.datastructures import FormData from starlette_admin import BaseField @dataclass class CustomField(BaseField): render_function_key: str = "mycustomkey" form_template: str = "forms/custom.html" display_template: str = "displays/custom.html" async def parse_form_data(self, request: Request, form_data: FormData) -> Any: return form_data.get(self.name) async def serialize_value(self, request: Request, value: Any, action: RequestAction) -> Any: return value def dict(self) -> Dict[str, Any]: return super().dict() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing Multiple Admin Instances in Starlette with Custom Routes and Views DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create and configure multiple admin instances in a Starlette application. It shows the setup of two admin interfaces with different base URLs, route names, and model views. The code also includes assertions to verify the correct URL path generation for each admin instance. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/user-guide/multiple-admin/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from starlette.applications import Starlette from starlette_admin import BaseAdmin as Admin from starlette_admin.contrib.sqla import ModelView app = Starlette() admin1 = Admin( "Admin1", base_url="/admin1", route_name="admin1", templates_dir="templates/admin1" ) admin1.add_view(ModelView(Report)) admin1.add_view(ModelView(Post)) admin1.mount_to(app) admin2 = Admin( "Admin2", base_url="/admin2", route_name="admin2", templates_dir="templates/admin2" ) admin2.add_view(ModelView(Post)) admin2.add_view(ModelView(User)) admin2.mount_to(app) assert app.url_path_for("admin1:index") == "/admin1/" assert app.url_path_for("admin2:index") == "/admin2/" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Export Options in ModelView DESCRIPTION: Shows how to configure data export options including field selection and export types. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/user-guide/configurations/modelview/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from starlette_admin import ExportType class PostView(ModelView): export_fields = [Post.id, Post.content, Post.tags] export_types = [ExportType.CSV, ExportType.EXCEL] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Custom Object Representation DESCRIPTION: Shows how to customize object representation in the admin interface using __admin_repr__ method. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/user-guide/configurations/modelview/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` class User: id: int first_name: str last_name: str async def __admin_repr__(self, request: Request): return f"{self.last_name} {self.first_name}" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing File Management with SQLAlchemy in Starlette-Admin DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to set up a Book model with file handling capabilities using SQLAlchemy-file. Demonstrates the use of FileField for document storage and ImageField for cover images with thumbnail support. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/user-guide/files/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from sqlalchemy import Column, Integer, String from sqlalchemy.orm import declarative_base from sqlalchemy_file import FileField, ImageField from starlette_admin.contrib.sqla import ModelView Base = declarative_base() class Book(Base): __tablename__ = "book" id = Column(Integer, autoincrement=True, primary_key=True) title = Column(String(50), unique=True) cover = Column(ImageField(thumbnail_size=(128, 128))) content = Column(FileField) class BookView(ModelView): pass admin.add_view(BookView(Book)) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Datatable Extensions in ModelView DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to enable/disable various DataTables extensions in the ModelView. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/user-guide/configurations/modelview/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` class PostView(ModelView): column_visibility = False search_builder = False responsive_table = True save_state = True ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Metadata for PostView in Starlette-Admin DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to set metadata such as identity, name, label, and icon for the PostView class. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/advanced/base-model-view/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from starlette_admin import BaseModelView class PostView(BaseModelView): identity = "post" name = "Post" label = "Blog Posts" icon = "fa fa-blog" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Fields in Starlette Admin ModelView DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to customize fields in a ModelView using SQLAlchemy models with Starlette Admin. Shows basic setup of a Post model and corresponding PostView with custom field configurations. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/user-guide/configurations/modelview/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from sqlalchemy import JSON, Column, Integer, String, Text, create_engine from sqlalchemy.ext.declarative import declarative_base from starlette.applications import Starlette from starlette_admin import TagsField from starlette_admin.contrib.sqla import Admin, ModelView Base = declarative_base() engine = create_engine("sqlite:///test.db", connect_args={"check_same_thread": False}) class Post(Base): __tablename__ = "posts" id = Column(Integer, primary_key=True) title = Column(String) tags = Column(JSON) content = Column(Text) class PostView(ModelView): fields = ["id", "title", Post.content, TagsField("tags", label="Tags")] app = Starlette() admin = Admin(engine) admin.add_view(PostView(Post, icon="fa fa-blog")) admin.mount_to(app) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Links and Dropdowns to Admin Interface DESCRIPTION: Examples of adding external links and dropdown menus to group related views in the admin interface navigation. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/user-guide/getting-started/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from starlette_admin.views import Link admin.add_view(Link(label="Home Page", icon="fa fa-link", url="/")) ``` LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from starlette_admin import CustomView, DropDown from starlette_admin.contrib.sqla import ModelView from starlette_admin.views import Link from .models import User admin.add_view( DropDown( "Resources", icon="fa fa-list", views=[ ModelView(User), Link(label="Home Page", url="/"), CustomView(label="Dashboard", path="/dashboard", template_path="dashboard.html"), ], ) ) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Row Actions Display in Starlette-Admin Python DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to configure the display type for row actions in a Starlette-Admin ModelView. It shows two options: ICON_LIST and DROPDOWN. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/user-guide/actions/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from starlette_admin._types import RowActionsDisplayType class ArticleView(ModelView): row_actions_display_type = RowActionsDisplayType.ICON_LIST ``` LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from starlette_admin._types import RowActionsDisplayType class ArticleView(ModelView): row_actions_display_type = RowActionsDisplayType.DROPDOWN ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Row Actions in Starlette-Admin Python DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to implement custom row actions in a Starlette-Admin ModelView. It includes examples of a 'make_published' row action with a custom form and a 'go_to_example' link row action. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/user-guide/actions/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from typing import Any from starlette.datastructures import FormData from starlette.requests import Request from starlette_admin._types import RowActionsDisplayType from starlette_admin.actions import link_row_action, row_action from starlette_admin.contrib.sqla import ModelView from starlette_admin.exceptions import ActionFailed class ArticleView(ModelView): ... row_actions = ["view", "edit", "go_to_example", "make_published", "delete"] # edit, view and delete are provided by default row_actions_display_type = RowActionsDisplayType.ICON_LIST # RowActionsDisplayType.DROPDOWN @row_action( name="make_published", text="Mark as published", confirmation="Are you sure you want to mark this article as published ?", icon_class="fas fa-check-circle", submit_btn_text="Yes, proceed", submit_btn_class="btn-success", action_btn_class="btn-info", form="""
""", ) async def make_published_row_action(self, request: Request, pk: Any) -> str: # Write your logic here data: FormData = await request.form() user_input = data.get("example-text-input") if ...: # Display meaningfully error raise ActionFailed("Sorry, We can't proceed this action now.") # Display successfully message return "The article was successfully marked as published" @link_row_action( name="go_to_example", text="Go to example.com", icon_class="fas fa-arrow-up-right-from-square", ) def go_to_example_row_action(self, request: Request, pk: Any) -> str: return f"https://example.com/?pk={pk}" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Initial Sort Order in Starlette Admin ModelView DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to configure default sorting for a User model view using the fields_default_sort property. Demonstrates sorting by last_name ascending and first_name descending. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/changelog/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` class User: id: int last_name: str first_name: str class UserView(ModelView): fields_default_sort = ["last_name", ("first_name", True)] admin.add_view(UserView(User)) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: MongoEngine Model Validation DESCRIPTION: Shows how to implement validation in MongoEngine using Document and EmbeddedDocument with field validators. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/user-guide/validations/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` import mongoengine as db class Comment(db.EmbeddedDocument): name = db.StringField(min_length=3, max_length=20, required=True) value = db.StringField(max_length=20) class Post(db.Document): name = db.StringField(max_length=20, required=True) value = db.StringField(max_length=20) inner = db.ListField(db.EmbeddedDocumentField(Comment)) lols = db.ListField(db.StringField(max_length=20)) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Available Field Types in Starlette Admin DESCRIPTION: This code block enumerates all the field types available in the starlette_admin.fields module. It includes basic data types, specialized fields for various purposes, and relationship fields for database connections. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/user-guide/validations/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from typing import List, Optional from odmantic import EmbeddedModel, Field, Model from pydantic import EmailStr class Address(EmbeddedModel): street: str = Field(min_length=3) city: str = Field(min_length=3) state: Optional[str] zipcode: Optional[str] class Author(Model): first_name: str = Field(min_length=3) last_name: str = Field(min_length=3) email: Optional[EmailStr] addresses: List[Address] = Field(default_factory=list) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Package Dependencies List DESCRIPTION: Lists the main project dependencies: Starlette for the web framework, SQLAlchemy for database ORM, and Uvicorn for ASGI server implementation SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/examples/tutorials/basic/sqla/requirements.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` starlette-admin sqlalchemy uvicorn ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Full PostView Class in Starlette-Admin DESCRIPTION: This comprehensive example shows a complete implementation of the PostView class, including the Post model, database operations, and all required CRUD methods. SOURCE: https://github.com/jowilf/starlette-admin/blob/main/docs/advanced/base-model-view/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from dataclasses import dataclass from typing import Any, Dict, Iterable, List, Optional, Union from starlette.requests import Request from starlette_admin import IntegerField, StringField, TagsField, TextAreaField from starlette_admin.exceptions import FormValidationError from starlette_admin.views import BaseModelView @dataclass class Post: id: int title: str content: str tags: List[str] def is_valid_for_term(self, term): return ( str(term).lower() in self.title.lower() or str(term).lower() in self.content.lower() or any([str(term).lower() in tag.lower() for tag in self.tags]) ) def update(self, data: Dict): for key, value in data.items(): if hasattr(self, key): setattr(self, key, value) db: Dict[int, Post] = dict() next_id = 1 def filter_values(values: Iterable[Post], term): filtered_values = [] for value in values: if value.is_valid_for_term(term): filtered_values.append(value) return filtered_values class PostView(BaseModelView): identity = "post" name = "Post" label = "Blog Posts" icon = "fa fa-blog" pk_attr = "id" fields = [ IntegerField("id"), StringField("title"), TextAreaField("content"), TagsField("tags"), ] sortable_fields = ("id", "title", "content") search_builder = False async def count( self, request: Request, where: Union[Dict[str, Any], str, None] = None, ) -> int: values = list(db.values()) if where is not None: values = filter_values(values, where) return len(values) async def find_all( self, request: Request, skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, where: Union[Dict[str, Any], str, None] = None, order_by: Optional[List[str]] = None, ) -> List[Any]: values = list(db.values()) if order_by is not None: assert len(order_by) < 2, "Not supported" if len(order_by) == 1: key, dir = order_by[0].split(maxsplit=1) values.sort(key=lambda v: getattr(v, key), reverse=(dir == "desc")) if where is not None and isinstance(where, (str, int)): values = filter_values(values, where) if limit > 0: return values[skip : skip + limit] return values[skip:] async def find_by_pk(self, request: Request, pk): return db.get(int(pk), None) async def find_by_pks(self, request: Request, pks): return [db.get(int(pk)) for pk in pks] async def validate_data(self, data: Dict): errors = {} if data["title"] is None or len(data["title"]) < 3: errors["title"] = "Ensure title has at least 03 characters" if data["tags"] is None or len(data["tags"]) < 1: errors["tags"] = "You need at least one tag" if len(errors) > 0: raise FormValidationError(errors) async def create(self, request: Request, data: Dict): await self.validate_data(data) global next_id obj = Post(id=next_id, **data) db[next_id] = obj next_id += 1 return obj async def edit(self, request: Request, pk, data: Dict): await self.validate_data(data) db[int(pk)].update(data) return db[int(pk)] async def delete(self, request: Request, pks: List[Any]) -> Optional[int]: cnt = 0 for pk in pks: value = await self.find_by_pk(request, pk) if value is not None: del db[int(pk)] cnt += 1 return cnt ```
